Content Description
This collections consists of three 8mm reels depicting the construction of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge. The reels were shot by Raymond Love, a construction worker on the bridge.
Biographical / Historical
Raymond Love was always interested in photography and in 1953, after the birth of his daughter, he began to record movies on 8mm of his family. Each film he recorded was 8 minutes long; he spliced them together to make a longer film of each project. Raymond worked on the construction of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge, building the roadways near the end of the construction project.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of the Love Children (Kathi, Patrick, Joan, John, and Nora) in honor of their father, Raymond J. Love. Donation facilitated by Patrick Love.
